title: What technology was ripped off from star trek? - Quora

response.answer_text: The only technology that could be said to have been “ripped off" was the sound of the Red Alert, which I believe was adopted by many hospitals, because it was designed to be as attention-getting as possible even in a noisy environment. The doors that opened automatically as soon as you approached them inspired engineers to invent them in real life; now they're everywhere. However, the makers of Star Trek didn't have a way of doing it, other than to have two pro guys behind the scenes to open and close the doors on cue.

None as far as I know. There are some things that were inspired by Star Trek. The top of the list would be cell phones aka communicators. There’s also desktop computers. A third would be tablets like kindles and ipads. Star Trek always showed us a bright future with lots of gadgets. Some have come to be today and make our lives easier.

ORIGINAL QUESTION: What technology was ripped off from star trek? None. Star Trek is a TV show. It’s not real. It’s purely fantasy. Everything you see in Star Trek is the product of someone’s imagination. It doesn’t actually exist.
You can’t rip off imaginary technology. Cell phones may have been inspired by Star Trek communicators and tricorders.
